content: -the minimum dimensions of the panel after each round are included in the instructions notes -the headphones case is worked as two separate panels that are seamed together -the panels are worked in the round join the ends of each round with a slip_stitch if you re not changing colours between rounds mark the start/end of a round with a stitch marker and chain 1 before starting the next round -the instructions are written as if you re using 4 different colours the 4 colours are referenced as a b c and d where a uses the least yarn center of the panel and d uses the most yarn outside of panel -the case was designed for the airpods pro case but can be used for any other headphone case of similar size abbreviations -chain chain -single_crochet single_crochet sizes -st stitch -slip_stitch slip_stitch 7 5cm x 7 5cm not including the strap strap length is approx 7cm long materials -5mm crochet hook -scrap yarn option to use 4 different colours sport or worsted weight use either sport or worsted for the entire piece don t mix and match -1 stitch marker gauge -not critical just make sure the final size of your front and back panels are at least 7 5cm x 7 5cm otherwise the airpods case won t fit front panel foundation loop use colour a with your 5mm hook chain 4 join the first and last chains with a slip_stitch to create a loop single_crochet 12 into the loop you just created fasten_off to change colours 12 st 1 25cm diameter round 1 use colour b join yarn in one of the 12 st you created in the foundation loop 2 single_crochet in each stitch join first and last st in the round with a slip_stitch fasten_off to change colours 24 st 2 8cm diameter round 2 use colour c join yarn in one of the 24 st from round 1 **2 single_crochet in one st 1 single_crochet in the next 2 st** repeat pattern in ** until the end of the round join first and last st in the round with a slip_stitch fasten_off to change colours 32 st 4cm diameter round 3 use colour d join yarn in one of the 32 st from round 2 **1 single_crochet in 7 st 3 single_crochet in next st** repeat pattern in ** a total of 3 times 1 single_crochet in 2 st chain 3 skip 3 st 1 single_crochet in 2 st 3sc in last st of the round join first and last st in the round with a slip_stitch do not fasten_off or change colours the piece should now be square with the 3 single_crochet in 1 st creating the corners and the 1 single_crochet in 7 st creating the edges 39 st 6cm width round 4 use colour d chain 1 single_crochet in all stitches fasten_off 39 st 7 5cm width back panel -repeat the foundation loop round 1 and round 2 instructions from the
